b0e4847b-0c6d-4bc4-878e-e0dc9afa3793.description: Advocis, The Financial Advisors Association of Canada, is the largest voluntary professional membership association of financial advisors in Canada, representing more than 17,000 member-clients and 40 Chapters across the country. Advocis members are licensed, have a recognized designation or are currently enrolled in an approved designation program, adhere to the Advocis Code of Professional Conduct, and are actively providing financial advice to consumers.
b0e4847b-0c6d-4bc4-878e-e0dc9afa3793.name: Advocis Member

alignments.name: The Advocis Code of Professional Conduct
alignments.description: The Advocis Code of Professional Conduct (CPC) sets out the principles that Advocis Members of all categories are expected to abide by in their business activities and when liaising between clients and suppliers of financial and insurance products or services.

alignments.name: Professional Development Requirements
alignments.description: You must have at least one approved designation & maintain the designation with the conferring body or be enrolled in an approved designation program (designation must be obtained in three years). You must also carry sufficient E&O coverage in accordance with the nature & extent of your practice & meet annual professional development requirements.

13849a56-a966-438c-8046-00753e4729b7.description: Advocis, The Financial Advisors Association of Canada, is the largest voluntary professional membership association of financial advisors in Canada, representing more than 17,000 member-clients and 40 Chapters across the country. Associate Members are individuals in the financial service industry who are neither licensed nor designated and are not compensated for serving clients directly.
13849a56-a966-438c-8046-00753e4729b7.name: Associate Member

alignments.name: The Advocis Code of Professional Conduct
alignments.description: The Advocis Code of Professional Conduct (CPC) sets out the principles that Advocis Members of all categories are expected to abide by in their business activities and when liaising between clients and suppliers of financial and insurance products or services.

alignments.name: Professional Development Requirements
alignments.description: Associate Members must carry sufficient E&O coverage in accordance with the nature and extent of their practice. They must also meet Advocis’s annual professional development requirements. They do not provide financial advice or service to clients. They are required to maintain CE requirements also.

f4c94859-7345-4adf-b583-1808e8ddf9fa.description: Advocis, The Financial Advisors Association of Canada, is the largest voluntary professional membership association of financial advisors in Canada, representing more than 17,000 member-clients and 40 Chapters across the country. Retired Members are those who are either retired or working less than thirty hours per month in the financial services industry but who are not actively pursuing new business. This category includes individuals who have previously been given “life” membership status.
f4c94859-7345-4adf-b583-1808e8ddf9fa.name: Retired Member

alignments.name: The Advocis Code of Professional Conduct
alignments.description: The Advocis Code of Professional Conduct (CPC) sets out the principles that Advocis Members of all categories are expected to abide by in their business activities and when liaising between clients and suppliers of financial and insurance products or services.

alignments.name: Professional Development Requirements
alignments.description: Retired Members must carry sufficient E&O coverage in accordance with the nature and extent of their practice.

173381b7-d9bf-40c3-913c-927ef3a04499.description: Advocis, The Financial Advisors Association of Canada, is the largest voluntary professional membership association of financial advisors in Canada, representing more than 17,000 member-clients and 40 Chapters across the country. Student Members are those entering the financial services industry, have never offered financial advice, and are not licensed. They are registered in a licensing program or in a full-time financial services program of study at a recognized educational institution.
173381b7-d9bf-40c3-913c-927ef3a04499.name: Student Member

alignments.name: The Advocis Code of Professional Conduct
alignments.description: The Advocis Code of Professional Conduct (CPC) sets out the principles that Advocis Members of all categories are expected to abide by in their business activities and when liaising between clients and suppliers of financial and insurance products or services.
